lines.text: I wanted to be different. I wanted to be different.
And did running away from home make you different?
No.
I haven't had a decent picture taken of me since I've been able to walk.
We're headin' due west now.
Can't you just say left or right. I don't think anyone's used a compass in Manhattan since Henry Hudson.
You're being conspicuous.
You sure picked the right place not be noticed. Nobody looks at nobody in New York.
Nobody looks at anybody.
That's what I said!
You know, Claude, for a sister and fussbudget, you're not too bad.
You know, Jamie, for a brother and a cheapskate, you're not too bad either.
Okay, the first thing we have to do is look for fingerprints.
Fingerprints? Michelangelo lived about 500 years ago.
So, maybe he got arrested for making statues of naked people and they took his fingerprints.
How come you didn't take art appreciation lessons that summer when I did?
Because I was only in second grade and I was having a tough enough time figuring out who Dick and Jane and Spot were.
I found a picture of Michelangelo!
I've seen that picture before.
His nose looks busted.
I just read about that. It was broken in fight when he was young.
You mean he was a juvenile delinquent?
Of course, not. He was just a hot tempered genius.
Some excuse.
What's the difference between an angel and a cupid?
Angels wear clothes and have wings. Cupids are naked, except for bows and arrows.
You don't think I'm going to take any naked bath with you, do you?
I found another penny and a dime! Where'd all the money come from?
People probably throw coins in the pool and make a wish.
I guess the quarters are the rich people's money.
I don't think so. Poor people are the ones that have to make big wishes.
Don't mumble. I dislike mumblers.
I have something to discuss with the young lady after we've lunched. So, you'll entertain her brother with a game of War.
War?
War, Saxonburg!
Yes, Madame.
Boy, do I stink at keeping secrets!
Never trust anyone to find your treasures for you. Find your own! Children know that. That's why they treasure seashells and little stones.
inside yourself.
Maybe I'm an illusion.
